subject: Politics
title: Foucault and Modern Power
description: A 60-second lesson on Foucault and Modern Power.

hook.text: Foucault said power isn't just in governments. It's in schools, hospitals, and prisons. Power is everywhere, unseen.

buildup.text: Foucault argued that modern power works through norms, surveillance, and discipline â€” not just laws and force.

discovery.text: His concept of 'biopower' shows how states manage populations through health, education, and behavioral standards.

twist.text: You don't need chains to control people. Self-surveillance works better. We police ourselves without realizing it.

climax.text: Foucault's ideas explain how power operates in democracies â€” through culture, expertise, and institutional norms.

punchline.text: Modern power doesn't need tyrants. It works best when nobody notices it.

quiz.question: What did Foucault mean by 'biopower'?
options: States managing populations through health, education, and behavioral norms
The power of biology over political decisions
Military power based on biological weapons
